title: Learner-Generated Drawing Strategies for Understanding Mathematical Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Textual Reading Skills
context.additional_context: Blended instruction using digital devices and repeated reading control groups.

learning_goals: Learners can generate visual representations of mathematical concepts to explain core content with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can improve their understanding of new mathematical concepts by over 25% compared to pre-assessment through the visual creation process.
Learners can improve problem-solving rates by over 40% within 15 minutes by referencing generated visuals, even in low-prior-knowledge contexts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
